results.title: Sebastian the fox: the goldmine
results.creator_credit: Eltham Films, Patrick Ryan and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: Using a combination of live actors and a puppet - “Sebastian the Fox” - this film tells how two unscrupulous miners sell a supposedly worthless mine to Sebastian for 5 Pounds. Sebastian promptly unearths a nugget; the miners try to steal it. Sebastian, however, “outfoxes” them and the rascally pair are left with an old boot as the fox drives off with the nugget. No dialogue spoken. Credits include: writing by Tim Burstall; photography by Giorgio Mangiamele; editing by Alan Harkness and Michael Thornhill; music by George Dreyfus.

results.title: Sebastian the fox: the burglar
results.creator_credit: Eltham Films, Patrick Ryan and Tim Burstall
results.brief_description: Puppet film for children. Sebastian the Fox, caught in the rain, seeks refuge in a warm house. A burglar later enters the same house and disturbs the occupant. She mistakes Sebastian for the intruder, but he then catches the real burglar, and is suitably rewarded.

results.title: Sebastian the fox: the animal catcher
results.brief_description: Another adventure for Sebastian the Fox when he is caught by Professor Catchem, licensed animal catcher and pet shop owner. A young boy decides to buy Sebastian when he sees him in the display window, but Sebastian is too clever and outsmarts the boy and the professor. Puppets by Peter Scriven. Music by George Dreyfus.

results.title: Sebastian and the sparrow
results.creator_credit: Kino Film Company and Scott Hicks
results.brief_description: 15 year old Sebastian thinks that he is hard done by. He has reached a feeling of boredom with his predictable middle class existence. He learns what hardship is really about when he encounters Sparrow at the local video parlour. Sparrow has more tougher trials to face, such as sleeping in clothing bins, scavenging for food and protecting himself from skinheads and the law. An uplifting story about how friendship can transcend social and economic boundaries. Starring Alexander Bainbridge, Jeremy Angerson and Elizabeth Alexander.

results.title: Seaweeds
results.brief_description: A fascinating, informative report of marine agronomy as it is being developed on Canada’s Atlantic coast. The film shows the work of the National Research Council’s Atlantic Regional Laboratory at Halifax and of Constance MacFarlane, marine botanist of the Nova Scotia Research Foundation. Efforts are directed at developing the food potentials of marine plants such as dulse, Irish moss, rockweed.

results.title: Seaweed walk
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rex Tasker and Barry Cowling
results.brief_description: A group of people take advantage of a unique program sponsored by the Nova Scotia Museum. Bus tours led by a botanist visit the seashore, where the visitors are encouraged to identify the many varieties of seaweed. The guide describes the biological characteristics and commercial uses of the marine plants.

results.title: Seaway to the heartland
results.creator_credit: Fred Gorman Films and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This is the story of the St. Lawrence Seaway, its construction, its operation and its impact on our economy. It gives a brief historical review of the earlier canals, which were built as long as two hundred years ago. Narrated by Bob Gardiner.

results.title: Seawatch
results.creator_credit: Kingcroft Productions, Film Australia and Peter Johnson
results.brief_description: A comprehensive view of the Australian Navy in action. The Navy is seen at work both above and below water in a series of exercises that leave little doubt of the strength and ability of Australia’s naval defences for the ‘80’s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kingcroft Productions, Film Australia and Peter Johnson

results.title: Seawards: the great ships
results.creator_credit: Templar Film Studios and Hilary Harris
results.brief_description: This documentary on the life and work of shipbuilders on Scotland’s Clyde River is historically notable as one of the last films on which John Grierson was creatively credited, preparing the outline treatment from which American Hilary Harris worked. Harris, who had previously produced interesting experimental work delivers inventive images and clever editing. Made for the Clyde Shipbuiders Association and the Films of Scotland Committee. Commentary by Bryden Murdoch. (Award: Oscar Best Short Subject/Best Live Action, 1961).

results.title: Seasonal changes in the temperate regions
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Frank Wells and Margaret Simpson
results.brief_description: Attention is concentrated on the temperate regions of the earth. These are shown to lie between the Tropical and Polar regions. Owing to the tilting of the earth’s axis and its movement round the sun, the temperature of these regions is very different at opposite times of the year. This point is brought out by examining the position regarding temperature in these regions in June and December. Then the two transitional seasons, in March and September, are also examined.
